intro: Rudgea nebulicola, commonly known as the misty rudgea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rudgea nebulicola is often found in humid, shaded environments, thriving in the understory of tropical forests.
